snippet: For the designers behind the Sigerson Morrison label, the dream of becoming the next Manolo Blahnik or Jimmy Choo turns sour. Very sour.
abstract: Kari Sigerson and Miranda Morrison, the designers behind the Sigerson Morrison shoe label, are embroiled in a legal battle with Marc Fisher, who in 2006 paid $2.6 million to acquire the label; the two women were fired in 2011 because of discrepancies over the manufacturing of the shoes, and now find themselves watching from the sidelines as the brand is reborn.
lead_paragraph: For the designers behind the Sigerson Morrison label, the dream of becoming the next Manolo Blahnik or Jimmy Choo turns sour. Very sour.
